newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee firms against dollar and pound.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee firms against dollar and pound.

text.p: The Mauritian rupee firmed against both the dollar and the British pound on Friday as a result of external factors, commercial forex dealers said.
The rupee was quoted at a mean commercial rate of 20.171 against the dollar from 20.186 on Thursday.
Against the pound, the rupee traded at a mean rate of 33.135 from 33.225 on Thursday.
Dealers said the dollar weakened on international markets, strengthening the Mauritian rupee.
"Actually, the Mauritian money market is quiet, as there is no big activity in the inter-bank forex market. Importers' demands were met by central bank intervention last Tuesday," said one dealer.
